cards.name: Scrivener
cards.text: When Scrivener enters the battlefield, you may return target instant card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: A good memory is no match for a good scribe.
cards.originalText: When Scrivener enters the battlefield, you may return target instant card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Sea Drake
cards.text:
Flying
When Sea Drake enters the battlefield, return two target lands you control to their owner's hand.

rulings.text: When the ability resolves, if one of the lands has become an illegal target (because it's no longer on the battlefield, for example), you return the other one to your hand. If both of the lands have become illegal targets, the ability doesn't resolve. This has no effect on Sea Drake.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Sea Drake enters the battlefield, return two target lands you control to their owner's hand.

cards.name: Serendib Efreet
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, Serendib Efreet deals 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor: Summoners of efreeti remember only the power of command, never the sting of regret.
cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, Serendib Efreet deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Skywing Aven
cards.text:
Flying
Discard a card: Return Skywing Aven to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: "I am as the wind that bears me: harsh yet gentle, fleeting yet ever-present. Together we fly beyond imagination."
cards.originalText:
Flying
Discard a card: Return Skywing Aven to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Stroke of Genius
cards.text: Target player draws X cards.
cards.flavor: After a hundred failed experiments, Urza was stunned to find that common silver passed through the portal undamaged. He immediately designed a golem made of the metal.
cards.originalText: Target player draws X cards.

cards.name: Temporal Fissure
cards.text:
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

rulings.text: The copies are put directly onto the stack. They aren't cast and won't be counted by other spells with storm cast later in the turn.
Spells cast from zones other than a player's hand and spells that were countered are counted by the storm ability.
A copy of a spell can be countered like any other spell, but it must be countered individually. Countering a spell with storm won't affect the copies.
The triggered ability that creates the copies can itself be countered by anything that can counter a triggered ability. If it is countered, no copies will be put onto the stack.
You may choose new targets for any of the copies. You can choose differently for each copy.

cards.originalText:
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

cards.name: Thalakos Drifters
cards.text: Discard a card: Thalakos Drifters gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
cards.flavor: They drift in and out of shadow and ever on toward madness.

rulings.text: The reminder text is only accurate when this card has Shadow.

cards.originalText: Discard a card: Thalakos Drifters gains shadow until end of turn. (It can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

cards.name: Tradewind Rider
cards.text:
Flying
{T}, Tap two untapped creatures you control: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: It is said that the wind will blow the world past if you wait long enough.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}, Tap two untapped creatures you control: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Turnabout
cards.text: Choose artifact, creature, or land. Tap all untapped permanents of the chosen type target player controls, or untap all tapped permanents of that type that player controls.

rulings.text: You decide on resolution if you are tapping or untapping, and which kind of permanent you are affecting.

cards.originalText: Choose artifact, creature, or land. Tap all untapped permanents of the chosen type target player controls, or untap all tapped permanents of that type that player controls.

cards.name: Upheaval
cards.text: Return all permanents to their owners' hands.
cards.flavor: The calm comes after the storm.
cards.originalText: Return all permanents to their owners' hands.

cards.name: Volrath's Shapeshifter
cards.text:
As long as the top card of your graveyard is a creature card, Volrath's Shapeshifter has the full text of that card and has the text "{2}: Discard a card." (Volrath's Shapeshifter has that card's name, mana cost, color, types, abilities, power, and toughness.)
{2}: Discard a card.

rulings.text: If the top card in the graveyard has any other undefined characteristics, then those characteristics are not acquired and the shapeshifter uses the characteristic from its own card.

If the top card in your graveyard is a creature card, this card uses the listed characteristics, including color and any other types. But, this card keeps the granted ability in addition to those from the card being copied.
When it changes forms, any "enters the battlefield" abilities of the card it "copies" do not trigger.
A copy of a Volrath's Shapeshifter will have the shapeshifting ability.

If the top card in your graveyard isn't a creature card (meaning a card with the type Creature, which may or may not have other types such as Artifact or Enchantment), then it's just a 0/1 blue creature. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.
The ability that sets its characteristics is a text-changing effect.

cards.originalText:
As long as the top card of your graveyard is a creature card, Volrath's Shapeshifter has the full text of that card and has the text "{2}: Discard a card." (Volrath's Shapeshifter has that card's name, mana cost, color, types, abilities, power, and toughness.)
{2}: Discard a card.

cards.name: Waterfront Bouncer
cards.text: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Closing time comes earlier to some than to others.
cards.originalText: {U}, {T}, Discard a card: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Addle
cards.text: Choose a color. Target player reveals their hand and you choose a card of that color from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"I'll wring out your tiny mind like a sponge."
—Urborg witch
cards.originalText: Choose a color. Target player reveals his or her hand and you choose a card of that color from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Animate Dead
cards.text:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.

rulings.text: Animate Dead is an Aura, albeit with an unusual enchant ability. You target a creature card in a graveyard when you cast it. It enters the battlefield attached to that card. Then it returns that card to the battlefield, and attaches itself to the card again (since the card is a new object on the battlefield). Animate Dead itself never moves into a graveyard during this process.
If Animate Dead isn't on the battlefield as its triggered ability resolves, none of its effects happen. The creature card won't be returned to the battlefield.

Abilities such as shroud and protection function only on the battlefield unless otherwise specified. A creature card with shroud may be targeted by Animate Dead, and Animate Dead will become attached to the creature that enters the battlefield.

If the creature put onto the battlefield has protection from black—or if the creature can't legally be enchanted by Animate Dead for another reason—Animate Dead won't be able to attach to it. It will be put into the graveyard as a state-based action, causing its delayed triggered ability to trigger. When the trigger resolves, if the creature's still on the battlefield, its controller will sacrifice it.

Once the creature is returned to the battlefield, Animate Dead can't be attached to anything other than it (unless Animate Dead somehow manages to put a different creature onto the battlefield). Attempting to move Animate Dead to another creature won't work.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature card in a graveyard
When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it.
Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.

cards.name: Baleful Force
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"As with any malevolent being, the trick is knowing how long you can afford to keep it in your service."
—Liliana Vess
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Cabal Ritual
cards.text:
Add {B}{B}{B}.
Threshold — Add {B}{B}{B}{B}{B} instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Each syllable chills your veins. Each word rattles your mind."
—Cabal Patriarch
cards.originalText:
Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
Threshold — Add {B}{B}{B}{B}{B} to your mana pool instead if seven or more cards are in your graveyard.

cards.name: Carnophage
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, tap Carnophage unless you pay 1 life.
cards.flavor: Eating is all it knows.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, tap Carnophage unless you pay 1 life.

cards.name: Chainer's Edict
cards.text:
Target player sacrifices a creature.
Flashback {5}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.originalText:
Target player sacrifices a creature.
Flashback {5}{B}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Choking Sands
cards.text: Destroy target non-Swamp land. If that land was nonbasic, Choking Sands deals 2 damage to the land's controller.
cards.flavor:
"The people wiped the sand from their eyes and cursed—and left the barren land to the hyenas and vipers."
—Afari, Tales
cards.originalText: Destroy target non-Swamp land. If that land was nonbasic, Choking Sands deals 2 damage to the land's controller.

cards.name: Crovax the Cursed
cards.text:
Crovax the Cursed enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice a creature. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Crovax. If you don't, remove a +1/+1 counter from Crovax.
{B}: Crovax gains flying until end of turn.

rulings.text: Crovax can sacrifice itself to its upkeep triggered ability.
You can only sacrifice one creature to it each turn.
If you choose not to sacrifice a creature and he has no +1/+1 counters, then nothing bad happens. Note that some other effect must be keeping him alive if he has no counters.

cards.originalText:
Crovax the Cursed enters the battlefield with four +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice a creature. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Crovax. If you don't, remove a +1/+1 counter from Crovax.
{B}: Crovax gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Cruel Bargain
cards.text: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.
cards.originalText: Draw four cards. You lose half your life, rounded up.

cards.name: Dark Hatchling
cards.text:
Flying
When Dark Hatchling enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText:
Flying
When Dark Hatchling enters the battlefield, destroy target nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B}.
cards.flavor:
"Leshrac, my liege, grant me the power I am due."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer
cards.originalText: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Dauthi Mercenary
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{1}{B}: Dauthi Mercenary gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:

—Lyna, soltari emissary
cards.originalText:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
{1}{B}: Dauthi Mercenary gets +1/+0 until end of turn

cards.name: Death's-Head Buzzard
cards.text:
Flying
When Death's-Head Buzzard dies, all creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Infested with vermin, ever hungering, dropping from night's sky.

rulings.text: The last ability of Death's-Head Buzzard affects only creatures on the battlefield at the time it resolves. Creatures that enter the battlefield later in the turn won't get -1/-1.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Death's-Head Buzzard dies, all creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Demonic Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You pick a card on resolution.
You don't reveal the card to your opponent.
This card is put directly into your hand. It is not drawn.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a card and put that card into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Drakestown Forgotten
cards.text:
Drakestown Forgotten enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{2}{B}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Drakestown Forgotten: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: If Drakestown Forgotten enters the battlefield from a graveyard, it counts itself when determining the value of X.

cards.originalText:
Drakestown Forgotten enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{2}{B}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Drakestown Forgotten: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Expunge
cards.text:
Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Fallen Askari
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Fallen Askari can't block.
cards.flavor: In troubled times, there are few greater sorrows than a wayward savior.
cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Fallen Askari can't block.

cards.name: Famine
cards.text: Famine deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor:
"Better to starve to death than be bored to death."
—Liliana Vess
cards.originalText: Famine deals 3 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Fledgling Djinn
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, Fledgling Djinn deals 1 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"The young can be quite dangerous. Trust me, I should know."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, Fledgling Djinn deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Hymn to Tourach
cards.text: Target player discards two cards at random.
cards.flavor: The priests plead for your anguish and pray for your despair.
cards.originalText: Target player discards two cards at random.

cards.name: Ichorid
cards.text:
Haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ichorid.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Ichorid is in your graveyard, you may exile a black creature card other than Ichorid from your graveyard. If you do, return Ichorid to the battlefield.

rulings.text: If multiple Ichorids are in your graveyard, you can't exile the same creature card to return each of them to the battlefield.
If one Ichorid's ability exiles another, the exiled Ichorid's ability can't return it to the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ichorid.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Ichorid is in your graveyard, you may exile a black creature card other than Ichorid from your graveyard. If you do, return Ichorid to the battlefield.

cards.name: Kezzerdrix
cards.text:
First strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, if your opponents control no creatures, Kezzerdrix deals 4 damage to you.
cards.originalText:
First strike
At the beginning of your upkeep, if your opponents control no creatures, Kezzerdrix deals 4 damage to you.

cards.name: Laquatus's Champion
cards.text:
When Laquatus's Champion enters the battlefield, target player loses 6 life.
When Laquatus's Champion leaves the battlefield, that player gains 6 life.
{B}: Regenerate Laquatus's Champion.
cards.flavor: Chainer's dark gift to a darker soul.

rulings.text: As Laquatus's Champion's second ability resolves, the player who gains 6 life is the player who was the target of the first ability (or, if that ability is still on the stack, the player who is its target).

cards.originalText:
When Laquatus's Champion enters the battlefield, target player loses 6 life.
When Laquatus's Champion leaves the battlefield, that player gains 6 life.
{B}: Regenerate Laquatus's Champion.

cards.name: Living Death
cards.text: Each player exiles all creature cards from their graveyard, then sacrifices all creatures they control, then puts all cards they exiled this way onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: As Living Death resolves, all players exile their creature cards from graveyards at the same time. Then all players sacrifice all creatures they control at the same time. Then all players put all creatures they exiled onto the battlefield at the same time.

Only cards exiled by Living Death's first instruction are put onto the battlefield. If a replacement effect (such as that of Leyline of the Void) causes any of the sacrificed creatures to be exiled instead of put into a graveyard, those cards aren't returned to the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Each player exiles all creature cards from his or her graveyard, then sacrifices all creatures he or she controls, then puts all cards he or she exiled this way onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Lurking Evil
cards.text: Pay half your life, rounded up: Lurking Evil becomes a 4/4 Horror creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Ash is our air, darkness our flesh."
—Phyrexian Scriptures

rulings.text: If you have zero or negative life, half your life is zero, so it costs nothing to use the ability.
When it turns into a creature, it is no longer an enchantment.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: Pay half your life, rounded up: Lurking Evil becomes a 4/4 Horror creature with flying.

cards.name: Mesmeric Fiend
cards.text:
When Mesmeric Fiend enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals their hand and you choose a nonland card from it. Exile that card.
When Mesmeric Fiend leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: If Mesmeric Fiend leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile a nonland card from the target opponent's hand indefinitely.

cards.originalText:
When Mesmeric Fiend enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals his or her hand and you choose a nonland card from it. Exile that card.
When Mesmeric Fiend leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Nature's Ruin
cards.text: Destroy all green creatures.
cards.flavor: One chill blast—the exhalation of the grave.
cards.originalText: Destroy all green creatures.

cards.name: Necropotence
cards.text:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you discard a card, exile that card from your graveyard.
Pay 1 life: Exile the top card of your library face down. Put that card into your hand at the beginning of your next end step.

rulings.text: If a discarded card isn't put into your graveyard (due to an effect such as that of Obstinate Baloth) or leaves your graveyard (perhaps because another effect returned it to your hand), it won't be exiled.
If you discard a card with madness and wish to cast it, Necropotence's ability won't exile that card. If you don't wish to cast it, you choose whether it ends up exiled or in your graveyard.

Necropotence's last ability creates a delayed triggered ability that will put the exiled card into your hand. That ability still triggers even if Necropotence is removed from the battlefield before your end step.

cards.originalText:
Skip your draw step.
Whenever you discard a card, exile that card from your graveyard.
Pay 1 life: Exile the top card of your library face down. Put that card into your hand at the beginning of your next end step.

cards.name: Nightscape Familiar
cards.text:
Blue spells and red spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Nightscape Familiar.
cards.flavor: Nightscape masters don't stop at raising the spirit of a fallen battlemage. They raise the flesh along with it.

rulings.text: If a spell is both blue and red, you pay {1} less, not {2} less.

The generic X cost is still considered generic even if there is a requirement that a specific color be used for it. For example, "only black mana can be spent this way". This distinction is important for effects which reduce the generic portion of a spell's cost.
This can lower the cost to zero, but not below zero.
The effect is cumulative.
The lower cost is not optional like with some other cost reducers.
Can never affect the colored part of the cost.
If this card is sacrificed to pay part of a spell's cost, the cost reduction still applies.

cards.originalText:
Blue spells and red spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Nightscape Familiar.

cards.name: Paralyze
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Paralyze enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {4}. If the player does, untap the creature.

rulings.text: Paying the cost is optional.
Paralyze can be cast targeting a creature which is already tapped.
The creature can only be untapped using Paralyze once per turn.
Two Paralyzes are not cumulative. Paying either one will untap the creature.
This is a change from the most recent wording. As was the case in the past, Paralyze itself has the last triggered ability, rather than granting that ability to the enchanted creature.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
When Paralyze enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {4}. If he or she does, untap the creature.

cards.name: Phyrexian Defiler
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Defiler: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The third stage of the illness: muscle aches and persistent cough."
—Phyrexian progress notes
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Phyrexian Defiler: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Predatory Nightstalker
cards.text: When Predatory Nightstalker enters the battlefield, you may have target opponent sacrifice a creature.
cards.originalText: When Predatory Nightstalker enters the battlefield, you may have target opponent sacrifice a creature.

cards.name: Putrid Imp
cards.text:
Discard a card: Putrid Imp gains flying until end of turn.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Putrid Imp gets +1/+1 and can't block.
cards.originalText:
Discard a card: Putrid Imp gains flying until end of turn.
Threshold — As long as seven or more cards are in your graveyard, Putrid Imp gets +1/+1 and can't block.

cards.name: Reanimate
cards.text: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"You will learn to earn death."
—Volrath

rulings.text: You lose life equal to the converted mana cost of the card you're bringing back, so if you Reanimate Volrath's Shapeshifter, you lose three life, regardless of what the next card down is.

cards.originalText: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. You lose life equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Recurring Nightmare
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature, Return Recurring Nightmare to its owner's hand: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor:
"I am confined by sleep and defined by nightmare."
—Crovax

rulings.text: If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature, Return Recurring Nightmare to its owner's hand: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.name: Reign of the Pit
cards.text: Each player sacrifices a creature. Create an X/X black Demon creature token with flying, where X is the total power of the creatures sacrificed this way.

rulings.text: You choose which creature you are sacrificing first, then each other player in turn order does the same. The creatures are all sacrificed simultaneously.

Use the powers of the creatures as they last existed on the battlefield to determine the value of X, even if they were negative. For example, if the sacrificed creatures were 3/3, 5/5, 0/4, and -2/2, the Demon will be 6/6.

cards.originalText: Each player sacrifices a creature. Put an X/X black Demon creature token with flying onto the battlefield, where X is the total power of the creatures sacrificed this way.

cards.name: Sarcomancy
cards.text:
When Sarcomancy enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no Zombies on the battlefield, Sarcomancy deals 1 damage to you.
cards.originalText:
When Sarcomancy enters the battlefield, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no Zombies on the battlefield, Sarcomancy deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Skirge Familiar
cards.text:
Flying
Discard a card: Add {B}.
cards.flavor: The first Yawgmoth priest to harness their power was rewarded with several unique mutilations.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Discard a card: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Spinal Graft
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"This one has not screamed enough to show effective implantation. Kill it."
—Volrath
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
When enchanted creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Tendrils of Agony
cards.text:
Target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

rulings.text: The copies are put directly onto the stack. They aren't cast and won't be counted by other spells with storm cast later in the turn.
Spells cast from zones other than a player's hand and spells that were countered are counted by the storm ability.
A copy of a spell can be countered like any other spell, but it must be countered individually. Countering a spell with storm won't affect the copies.
The triggered ability that creates the copies can itself be countered by anything that can counter a triggered ability. If it is countered, no copies will be put onto the stack.
You may choose new targets for any of the copies. You can choose differently for each copy.

cards.originalText:
Target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

cards.name: Tyrant's Choice
cards.text: Will of the council — Starting with you, each player votes for death or torture. If death gets more votes, each opponent sacrifices a creature. If torture gets more votes or the vote is tied, each opponent loses 4 life.

rulings.text: If death gets more votes, each opponent chooses and sacrifices a creature they control. None of these creatures are targeted. An opponent could sacrifice a creature with protection from black, for example.
Because the votes are cast in turn order, each player will know the votes of players who voted beforehand.
You must vote for one of the available options. You can't abstain.
No player votes until the spell or ability resolves. Any responses to that spell or ability must be made without knowing the outcome of the vote.
Players can't do anything after they finishing voting but before the spell or ability that included the vote finishes resolving.

The phrase "the vote is tied" refers only to when there is more than one choice that received the most votes. For example, if a 5-player vote from among three different choices ends 3 votes to 1 vote to 1 vote, the vote isn't tied.

cards.originalText: Will of the council — Starting with you, each player votes for death or torture. If death gets more votes, each opponent sacrifices a creature. If torture gets more votes or the vote is tied, each opponent loses 4 life.

cards.name: Urborg Uprising
cards.text:
Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: In Urborg, few things are less permanent than death.

rulings.text: You can cast Urborg Uprising with zero targets if you only want to draw a card.
If you chose at least one target and all targets are illegal on resolution, you won't draw a card.

cards.originalText:
Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Vampiric Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"I write upon clean white parchment with a sharp quill and the blood of my students, divining their secrets."
—Shauku, Endbringer

rulings.text: The "shuffle and put the card on top" is a single action. If an effect causes the top card of the library to be face up, the second card down is not revealed.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.

cards.name: Visara the Dreadful
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: "My eyes are my strongest feature."
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Yawgmoth's Bargain
cards.text:
Skip your draw step.
Pay 1 life: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: He craves only one commodity.
cards.originalText:
Skip your draw step.
Pay 1 life: Draw a card.

cards.name: Yawgmoth's Will
cards.text:
Until end of turn, you may play cards from your graveyard.
If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere this turn, exile that card instead.

rulings.text: The second ability creates a replacement effect. It applies to both costs and effects.
If you cast a Buyback spell, then there will be two effects trying to replace where the card goes. You get to choose if the Buyback returns the card to your hand or the card gets exiled.

If an effect asks you to discard a card, you can't "discard" something that is in your graveyard. Those cards are not in your hand. Thus, Cycling abilities of cards in the graveyard can't be activated.
It will exile itself since it goes to the graveyard after its effect starts.
If you play a card using Yawgmoth's Will and something triggers only when "cast from your hand", that something will not trigger. Such things trigger based on where the card came from.
To "play a card" is to either cast a spell or to put a land onto the battlefield using the main phase special action.
You cannot Suspend a card from your graveyard, only your hand.

cards.originalText:
Until end of turn, you may play cards from your graveyard.
If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere this turn, exile that card instead.

cards.name: Aftershock
cards.text: Destroy target artifact, creature, or land. Aftershock deals 3 damage to you.
cards.flavor:
"Every act of destruction has a repercussion."
—Karn, silver golem
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact, creature, or land. Aftershock deals 3 damage to you.

cards.name: Beetleback Chief
cards.text: When Beetleback Chief enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens.
cards.flavor: Whether trained, ridden, or eaten, few goblin military innovations have rivaled the bug.
cards.originalText: When Beetleback Chief enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Burning of Xinye
cards.text: You destroy four lands you control, then target opponent destroys four lands they control. Then Burning of Xinye deals 4 damage to each creature.

rulings.text: Burning of Xinye targets only an opponent. If that player is an illegal target by the time Burning of Xinye resolves, the entire spell doesn't resolve.
The lands that will be destroyed aren't chosen until Burning of Xinye resolves.

A land with a regeneration shield on it will regenerate from Burning of Xinye's destruction effect. However, the spell or ability that creates that shield must be cast or activated before Burning of Xinye starts to resolve.

In a multiplayer game, only lands controlled by two players (you and the targeted opponent) are destroyed. However, Burning of Xinye will deal 4 damage to each creature, even those controlled by other players.

As Burning of Xinye resolves, first you destroy four lands you control (all at the same time), then the targeted opponent destroys four lands they control (all at the same time). That player chooses which of their lands to destroy. Neither of you can choose to destroy a land with indestructible.

cards.originalText: You destroy four lands you control, then target opponent destroys four lands he or she controls. Then Burning of Xinye deals 4 damage to each creature.

cards.name: Burning Wish
cards.text: You may choose a sorcery card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Burning Wish.
cards.flavor: She wished for a weapon, but not for the skill to wield it.

rulings.text: Can't acquire the Ante cards. They are considered still "in the game" as are cards in the library and the graveyard.
The choice is optional.
If you fail to find something, you still exile this.
Can't acquire cards that are phased out.
You can't acquire exiled cards because those cards are still in one of the game's zones.
In a sanctioned event, a card that's "outside the game" is one that's in your sideboard. In an unsanctioned event, you may choose any card from your collection.

cards.originalText: You may choose a sorcery card you own from outside the game, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Exile Burning Wish.

cards.name: Chain Lightning
cards.text: Chain Lightning deals 3 damage to any target. Then that player or that permanent's controller may pay {R}{R}. If the player does, they may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

rulings.text: The copy is a spell, so it can be targeted by other spells and abilities that target a spell.
The player putting the copy spell on the stack controls that spell.
The spell copy has all the text and can result in itself being copied.

As Chain Lightning resolves, the targeted player or the controller of the targeted creature may copy it. The copy has the same text, target, and color of the resolving spell, though the player who's copying it may choose a new target for it. Once that copy is created (or not), the first Chain Lightning has finished resolving and leaves the stack.
The player putting the copy of the spell on the stack controls that copy.
The copy of Chain Lightning is created on the stack, so it's not cast. Abilities that trigger when a player casts a spell won't trigger. Players may respond to that spell before it resolves.
If the targeted permanent or player is an illegal target when Chain Lightning tries to resolve, the spell doesn't resolve. It can't be copied.

cards.originalText: Chain Lightning deals 3 damage to target creature or player. Then that player or that creature's controller may pay {R}{R}. If the player does, he or she may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

cards.name: Chaos Warp
cards.text: The owner of target permanent shuffles it into their library, then reveals the top card of their library. If it's a permanent card, they put it onto the battlefield.

rulings.text: The owner of a token is the player under whose control the token was put onto the battlefield. If a token is shuffled into a player's library this way, that player shuffles before revealing the top card of that library.
If the permanent is an illegal target by the time Chaos Warp tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will occur. No library will be shuffled and no card will be revealed.
A permanent card is a card with one or more of the following card types: artifact, creature, enchantment, land, or planeswalker.
If the revealed card is a permanent card but can't enter the battlefield (perhaps because it's an Aura with nothing to enchant), it remains on top of that library.
If the revealed card is not a permanent card, it remains on top of that library.

cards.originalText: The owner of target permanent shuffles it into his or her library, then reveals the top card of his or her library. If it's a permanent card, he or she puts it onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Chartooth Cougar
cards.text:
{R}: Chartooth Cougar gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Mountaincycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Mountain card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.)

rulings.text: Unlike the normal cycling ability, Mountaincycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Mountain card. After you find a Mountain card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

Mountaincycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Mountaincycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Mountaincycling from being activated.

Mountaincycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Mountaincycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
You can choose to find any card with the Mountain land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Mountain card in your library.

cards.originalText:
{R}: Chartooth Cougar gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Mountaincycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Mountain card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

cards.name: Clickslither
cards.text:
Haste
Sacrifice a Goblin: Clickslither gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The least popular goblins get the outer caves.
cards.originalText:
Haste
Sacrifice a Goblin: Clickslither gets +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Crater Hellion
cards.text:
Echo {4}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Crater Hellion enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to each other creature.
cards.originalText:
Echo {4}{R}{R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
When Crater Hellion enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to each other creature.

cards.name: Falter
cards.text: Creatures without flying can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: Like a sleeping dragon, Shiv stirs and groans at times.
cards.originalText: Creatures without flying can't block this turn.

cards.name: Fireblast
cards.text:
You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Fireblast deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Embermages aren't well known for their diplomatic skills.
cards.originalText:
You may sacrifice two Mountains rather than pay Fireblast's mana cost.
Fireblast deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Flametongue Kavu
cards.text: When Flametongue Kavu enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor:
"For dim-witted, thick-skulled genetic mutants, they have pretty good aim."
—Sisay, captain of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: If it enters the battlefield as the only targetable creature, it must target itself.

cards.originalText: When Flametongue Kavu enters the battlefield, it deals 4 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Flowstone Hellion
cards.text:
Haste
{0}: Flowstone Hellion gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Volrath leaves no stone untrained.

rulings.text: It will be put into its owner's graveyard as soon as one of its abilities resolves that puts its toughness at zero (or less than the current amount of damage on it). This is a state-based action, so there is no way to activate its ability any more to increase its power further before it is put into the graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Haste
{0}: Flowstone Hellion gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Gamble
cards.text: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, discard a card at random, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: When you've got nothing, you might as well trade it for something else.

rulings.text: You might end up discarding the card you searched for.
You put the card into your hand and discard a card at random all while Gamble is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a card, put that card into your hand, discard a card at random, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Giant Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.
cards.flavor: "Crovax seems filled only with shadows," thought Orim. "Where does his strength come from?"
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.

cards.name: Goblin Commando
cards.text: When Goblin Commando enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: With a commando around, somebody's gonna get hurt.
cards.originalText: When Goblin Commando enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Goblin General
cards.text: Whenever Goblin General attacks, Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Lead, follow, or run around like crazy.
cards.originalText: Whenever Goblin General attacks, Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Goon
cards.text:
Goblin Goon can't attack unless you control more creatures than defending player.
Goblin Goon can't block unless you control more creatures than attacking player.
cards.flavor: Giant-sized body. Goblin-sized brain.
cards.originalText:
Goblin Goon can't attack unless you control more creatures than defending player.
Goblin Goon can't block unless you control more creatures than attacking player.

cards.name: Goblin Lackey
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Lackey deals damage to a player, you may put a Goblin permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: At the first sign of enemy scouts, Jula grinned and strapped on his diplomacy helmet.

rulings.text: A Goblin permanent card is an artifact, creature, land, and/or enchantment card with the creature type "Goblin". Usually such cards will be creatures in addition to any other types, but they may be tribal instead. For example, you could put Boggart Shenanigans onto the battlefield with this effect.

cards.originalText: Whenever Goblin Lackey deals damage to a player, you may put a Goblin permanent card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Goblin Matron
cards.text: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can search for any card with the creature type Goblin, including Creature or Tribal cards. Older cards of type "Summon Goblin" and "Summon Goblins" also count. You can't search for cards that have Goblin in the name but don't have the creature type Goblin.

cards.originalText: When Goblin Matron enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Goblin Patrol
cards.text: Echo {R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
cards.flavor:
"Take the sharp metal stick and make a lotta holes."
—Jula, goblin raider
cards.originalText: Echo {R} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)

cards.name: Goblin Piledriver
cards.text:
Protection from blue (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything blue.)
Whenever Goblin Piledriver attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Goblin.

rulings.text: The number of Goblins is counted when this ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
Protection from blue
Whenever Goblin Piledriver attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Goblin.

cards.name: Goblin Ringleader
cards.text:
Haste
When Goblin Ringleader enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Goblin cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

Haste
When Goblin Ringleader enters the battlefield, reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all Goblin cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.text: When Goblin Settler enters the battlefield, destroy target land.
cards.flavor: Be it ever so crumbled, there's no place like home.
cards.originalText: When Goblin Settler enters the battlefield, destroy target land.

cards.name: Goblin Warchief
cards.text:
Goblin spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Goblins you control have haste.
cards.flavor: They poured from the Skirk Ridge like lava, burning and devouring everything in their path.

rulings.text: Goblin Warchief's effect reduces only generic mana in the cost of Goblin spells you cast. For example, it doesn't reduce the cost of Skirk Prospector below {R}.

cards.originalText:
Goblin spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Goblin creatures you control have haste.

cards.name: Hulking Goblin
cards.text: Hulking Goblin can't block.
cards.flavor: The bigger they are, the harder they avoid work.
cards.originalText: Hulking Goblin can't block.

cards.name: Kaervek's Torch
cards.text:
As long as Kaervek's Torch is on the stack, spells that target it cost {2} more to cast.
Kaervek's Torch deals X damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
The pulsing heat of the midday Sun burns in the Lion's eye.
—Stone inscription, source unknown
cards.originalText:
As long as Kaervek's Torch is on the stack, spells that target it cost {2} more to cast.
Kaervek's Torch deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Kindle
cards.text: Kindle deals X damage to any target, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Kindle in all graveyards.
cards.flavor: Hope of deliverance is scorched by the fire of futility.

rulings.text: Because Kindle is still on the stack as you perform its instructions, it isn't in your graveyard and won't add to the amount of damage dealt.

cards.originalText: Kindle deals X damage to target creature or player, where X is 2 plus the number of cards named Kindle in all graveyards.

cards.text: Whenever a player cycles a card, you may pay {1}. If you do, Lightning Rift deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Options will cost you, but a lack of them will cost you even more.

rulings.text: You choose the target when this ability is put on the stack, but you do not decide whether or not to pay the mana until the ability resolves.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player cycles a card, you may pay {1}. If you do, Lightning Rift deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.text: Discard any number of cards at random. Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn for each card discarded this way.
cards.originalText: Discard any number of cards at random. Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn for each card discarded this way.

cards.name: Rorix Bladewing
cards.text: Flying, haste
cards.flavor: In the smoldering ashes of Shiv, a few dragons strive to rebuild their native land. The rest seek any opportunity to restore the broken pride of their race.
cards.originalText: Flying, haste

cards.name: Scourge of the Throne
cards.text:
Flying
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Whenever Scourge of the Throne attacks for the first time each turn, if it's attacking the player with the most life or tied for most life, untap all attacking creatures. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

rulings.text: Scourge of the Throne's ability has an intervening "if" clause. It must be attacking the player with the most life or tied with the most life both when it's declared as an attacker and as it starts to resolve for it to have any effect. If, at either time, the player isn't the one with the most life or tied for the most life, the ability will have no effect. Notably, this is different than how dethrone works. (Dethrone checks only once to see if the ability triggers.)
Dethrone doesn't trigger if the creature attacks a planeswalker, even if its controller has the most life.

Once dethrone triggers, it doesn't matter what happens to the players' life totals before the ability resolves. You'll put a +1/+1 counter on the creature even if the defending player doesn't have the most life as the ability resolves.
The +1/+1 counter is put on the creature before blockers are declared.
In a Two-Headed Giant game, dethrone will trigger if the creature attacks either player on the team with the most life or tied for the most life.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Dethrone (Whenever this creature attacks the player with the most life or tied for most life, put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
Whenever Scourge of the Throne attacks for the first time each turn, if it's attacking the player with the most life or tied for most life, untap all attacking creatures. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.

cards.name: Skirk Drill Sergeant
cards.text: Whenever Skirk Drill Sergeant or another Goblin dies, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Goblin permanent card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: "I order you to volunteer."
cards.originalText: Whenever Skirk Drill Sergeant or another Goblin dies, you may pay {2}{R}. If you do, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a Goblin permanent card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.

cards.name: Skirk Prospector
cards.text: Sacrifice a Goblin: Add {R}.
cards.flavor:
"I like goblins. They make funny little popping sounds when they die."
—Braids, dementia summoner
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a Goblin: Add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Solar Blast
cards.text:
Solar Blast deals 3 damage to any target.
Cycling {1}{R}{R} ({1}{R}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Solar Blast, you may have it deal 1 damage to any target.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn't resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

cards.originalText:
Solar Blast deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Cycling {1}{R}{R} ({1}{R}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Solar Blast, you may have it deal 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.text:
Spark Spray deals 1 damage to any target.
Cycling {R} ({R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
cards.flavor: It's the only kind of shower goblins will tolerate.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:
Spark Spray deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Cycling {R} ({R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText:

cards.name: Sulfuric Vortex
cards.text:

cards.originalText:

If a player would gain life, that player gains no life instead.
